title: Apple II
summary: The Apple II, released in June 1977, was one of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputers. It featured color graphics, an open architecture, and BASIC programming built-in.
significance: The Apple II democratized personal computing, bringing computers into homes and schools. Its open architecture inspired a vibrant ecosystem of third-party hardware and software. The computer remained in production for nearly two decades, making it one of the longest-lived computer platforms in history.
keyFigures: Steve Wozniak - Hardware designer and engineer
Mike Markkula - Early investor and business guidance
